Individuals meet criteria T1D subsequently classified type 2 diabetes (T2D). Inclusion events : HbA1c measurements ≥48 mmol/mol. Hospital diagnoses diabetes. Purchases combination drugs containing GLP-1 receptor agonists SGLT-2 inhibitors combination glucose-lowering drugs dropped. drug purchase made pregnancies, may related gestational diabetes mellitus, rather T1D T2D. purchased drug metformin made women age 40, may treatment polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). purchased drug metformin PCOS-related indication code. diabetes classification date defined date second occurrence inclusion events listed . example, individual two elevated HbA1c tests followed glucose-lowering drug purchase included latest elevated HbA1c test. second HbA1c test performed (returned result diagnostic threshold), person instead included date first purchase glucose-lowering drugs. title: Design
text: osdc package contains one main function classifies individuals either type 1 type 2 diabetes using Danish registers: classify_diabetes(). function classifies diabetes (type 1 2) based Danish registers described vignette("design") vignette("data-sources"). data sources needed osdc used input function. specific details classification algorithm described vignette("algorithm"). one argument classify_diabetes() required register. names descriptions arguments follows: bef: register called ‘CPR-registerets befolkningstabel’ Danish. lmdb: register called ‘Laegemiddelstatistikregisteret’ Danish. lpr_adm: register called ‘Landspatientregisterets administrationstabel (LPR2)’ Danish. lpr_diag: register called ‘Landspatientregisterets diagnosetabel (LPR2)’ Danish. kontakter: register called ‘Landspatientregisterets kontakttabel (LPR3)’ Danish. diagnoser: register called ‘Landspatientregisterets diagnosetabel (LPR3)’ Danish. sysi: register called ‘Sygesikringsregisteret’ Danish. sssy: register called ‘Sygesikringsregisteret’ Danish. lab_forsker: register called ‘Laboratoriedatabasens forskertabel’ Danish. output data.frame type object includes four columns: pnr: pseudonymised social security number individuals diabetes population (one row per individual). stable_inclusion_date: stable inclusion date (.e., raw date mutated individuals included time-period data coverage sufficient make incident cases reliable)1. raw_inclusion_date: raw inclusion date (.e., date second inclusion event described vignette("algorithm")). diabetes_type: classified diabetes type. example, see . Since date within time-period sufficient data coverage, column stable_inclusion_date populated date raw_inclusion_date. individual second row, 4 classified type 2 diabetes T2D inclusion date 1995-19-04. Since 1995 within time-period insufficient data coverage, validity inclusion date uncertain stable_inclusion_date NULL. However, raw_inclusion_date still contains inclusion date individual. context generating diabetes population valid inclusion dates (e.g. true incident cases), three aspects register records considered determining periods time sufficient data available: Sufficient data inclusion events: HbA1c test results diagnostic standard, records newest addition register data ecosystem limited historical coverage nationwide. According supplementary analyses Isaksen et al.[@Isaksen2023sup], data complete nationwide coverage Q4 2015 onward (direct link supplementary file S9). However, vast majority diabetes patients treated glucose-lowering drugs point, made pragmatic assessment prescription drug purchase data sufficient identify incident cases. available 1995 onward. Sufficient data exclusion events: order correctly identify pregnancies discard inclusion events may occur due gestational diabetes rather T1D T2D, register information pregnancy occurrences necessary. patient register, information available 1994 onward, coverage insufficient 1997, according supplementary analyses Isaksen[@isaksen2023thesis] (direct link analysis). Sufficient wash-period: order “wash ” prevalent cases true incident cases, period time valid data necessary capture prevalent cases, new inclusions can considered true incident cases incidence stabilizes. considered full year enough. Given requirements complete nationwide data inclusion exclusion events, well sufficient wash-period establish valid incident cases, algorithm designed restrict valid inclusion dates periods criteria met. Consequently, inclusion dates occurring 1998 onward considered true incident cases assigned stable_inclusion_date value.

title: Getting started
text: osdc (Open Source Diabetes Classifier) package classifies individuals type 1 diabetes (T1D) type 2 diabetes (T2D) based Danish register data. provide register data, package returns data table individuals identified diabetes, along diabetes type (T1D T2D) date classification. package serves two overarching purposes: provide open-source, code-based algorithm classify type 1 type 2 diabetes using Danish registers data sources. inspire discussions within Danish register-based research space openness ease use existing tooling registers, need official process updating contributing existing data sources. detailed description algorithm, see vignette("algorithm"). motivations rationale behind package, see vignette("rationale"). full list required register variables, see vignette("data-sources").

title: Getting started
text: section walks full workflow: loading package, preparing data, running classification, well understanding saving output. use simulated data , similar steps apply real register data. information using osdc real register data, see Section 3. First, need install load package: algorithm requires data multiple Danish registers. names registers can seen : table showing specific variables needed register, see vignette("data-sources"). Important use osdc algorithm, need variables described vignette("data-sources"), please ensure required variables continuing. package requires data DuckDB format, high-performance database format can handle large volumes data without loading everything memory . See vignette("design") use DuckDB. example, generate simulated register data using simulate_registers() convert DuckDB format: result named list element one register DuckDB table. classify_diabetes() function takes register separate argument, extract individual variables explicit : Now, ’re ready run classification algorithm. Pass register classify_diabetes(): seen , returns DuckDB table individuals classified either T1D T2D along date classification. columns output explained Section 2.5.1 . data stored DuckDB, result lazy reference database query, .e., data loaded R’s memory. bring results R regular data frame, use dplyr::collect(): Now, can see simulated data, 9 individuals classified diabetes. output table one row per classified individual five columns: stable_inclusion_date vs raw_inclusion_date raw_inclusion_date simply date second qualifying event. However, events 1998, register data may sufficient coverage reliably distinguish new (incident) cases existing (prevalent) ones. stable_inclusion_date column set NA earlier dates flag uncertainty. classify_diabetes() function includes stable_inclusion_start_date parameter 01-01-1988 default. means can change date classification considered stable information output, see Interface section vignette("design"). classification results, can save Parquet file collaborators DST project:

Considerable efforts made towards establishing tool diabetes research several countries, including Denmark (7–9). general population, classification algorithms (classifiers) need identify type 1 diabetes well type 2 diabetes, also account events might lead inclusion non-cases, use glucose-lowering drugs treatment conditions. Currently, type-specific diabetes classifier validated general population, leaves register-based studies area vulnerable biases. Denmark, limitation (flaw) RSCD publicly validated source code behind algorithm made publicly available. Notably, algorithm lacks inclusion based elevated HbA1c levels (10). Likewise, National Diabetes Register, since discontinued 2012, validation study question validity called future registers adopt inclusion based elevated HbA1c levels (11).
